name: Chanterelle
description:
Best played with a controller.  Web will lag slightly compared to download.

This game features a save system. It will auto-save your progress

Chanterelle is a procedurally generated, vertical platforming game.  You play as a mushroom who accidentally created an out-of-control bean stalk which he has to traverse to save his friends.  Once you beat the game, you can climb the beanstalk forever to try to get a high score!

This game was made in under a week for the GoGodotJam. It took us about 80h of cumulative work.  New: An "easy mode" was added. You can toggle it on at the bulletin board in town!

Controls:

  • Computer:
    • [ W | <-  ] [ D | -> ] Move
    • [Z | SPACE ] Jump
    • [X | ENTER ] Dash
  • Play Station Controller:
    • [ X ] Jump
    • [ Square | Circle } Dash
  • XBox Controller:
    • [ A ] Jump
    • [ B | X ] Dash
  • Switch Pro Controller:
    • [ B ] Jump
    • [ A | X ] Dash

You start with a air jump.  

The theme for the Jam was "Growth".

The theme of growth is incorporated into the game in two ways. First, in the explosive growth of the bean stalk which is the main antagonist of the game. Second, as the main character is able to master the beanstalk and progress ever further, they are able to rescue the other people of the town which results in the town growing as they move in and add their own charm.
